intro: Bentinckiopsis savoryana, commonly known as the slender bentinckia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that are clustered in a cylindrical shape. Bentinckiopsis savoryana is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it adapts well to arid conditions.
